title: Ball of the Century: Shane Warne's Delivery to Mike Gatting (1999 Ashes)
description: A delivery that defied logic, spinning viciously from outside the leg stump to clip Mike Gatting's bails. This moment marked the arrival of Shane Warne as a legend.

title: Sachin Tendulkar's Straight Drive at Lord's (1990)
description: A young Tendulkar's majestic straight drive off a fast bowler at the iconic Lord's Cricket Ground announced his arrival on the world stage.

title: Adam Gilchrist's Bat Flip at Sydney (2003 World Cup)
description: A jubilant celebration after hitting a six to win the 2003 World Cup final for Australia.

title: Jonty Rhodes' Flying Catch at Centurion (1992 World Cup)
description: A gravity-defying one-handed diving catch by Jonty Rhodes to dismiss Inzamam-ul-Haq, considered one of the greatest ever taken.

title: Wasim Akram's Inswing Yorker to Robin Smith (1992 World Cup)
description: A perfectly executed delivery that rattled Robin Smith's stumps and turned the tide of the 1992 World Cup final.

title: VVS Laxman's 281 at the SCG (2001 Border-Gavaskar Trophy)
description: A gritty and defiant double century against all odds on a turning Sydney Cricket Ground pitch, helping India win a historic Test match.

title: MS Dhoni's Helicopter Shot in World Cup Final (2011)
description: A cool and calculated shot to finish the 2011 World Cup final for India in style.

title: Brian Lara's 501 (2003)
description: Lara's record-breaking innings of 501 not out against England remains the highest individual score in Test cricket history.

title: Mitchell Johnson's Yorker to Stuart Broad (2013 Ashes)
description: A brutal, fast yorker that dismantled Stuart Broad's stumps and symbolized Australia's dominance in the 2013 Ashes series.

title: Yuvraj Singh's Six Sixes off Stuart Broad (2007 World Cup)
description: An incredible feat of hitting six consecutive sixes off a single over, etching his name in cricket history.

title: Ricky Ponting's Run Out of Inzamam-ul-Haq (2003 World Cup Final)
description: A crucial run-out that turned the tide in the thrilling 2003 World Cup final.

title: Muttiah Muralitharan's 800th Test Wicket (2007)
description: Becoming the first bowler to reach 800 Test wickets, a record that still stands today.

title: Andrew Symonds' One-Handed Catch at Point (2006 Ashes)
description: A spectacular one-handed catch at point to dismiss Kevin Pietersen, a turning point in the 2006 Ashes series.
